lines.text: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus and the Officer

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Fear me not, man I will not break away: Ill give thee, ere I leave thee, so much money, To warrant thee, as I am rested for. My wife is in a wayward mood today, And will not lightly trust the messenger That I should be attachd in Ephesus, I tell you, twill sound harshly in her ears. Here comes my man I think he brings the money. How now, sir! have you that I sent you for
Enter DROMIO of Ephesus with a ropesend

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Heres that, I warrant you, will pay them all. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: But wheres the money

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Why, sir, I gave the money for the rope. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Five hundred ducats, villain, for a rope

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Ill serve you, sir, five hundred at the rate. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: To what end did I bid thee hie thee home

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: To a ropesend, sir and to that end am I returned. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: And to that end, sir, I will welcome you.
Beating him

lines.speaker: officer
lines.text: Good sir, be patient.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Nay, tis for me to be patient I am in adversity.

lines.speaker: officer
lines.text: Good, now, hold thy tongue.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Nay, rather persuade him to hold his hands. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Thou whoreson, senseless villain!

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: I would I were senseless, sir, that I might not feel your blows.

lines.speaker: antipholus
lines.text: Thou art sensible in nothing but blows, and so is an ass.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: I am an ass, indeed you may prove it by my long ears. I have served him from the hour of my nativity to this instant, and have nothing at his hands for my service but blows. When I am cold, he heats me with beating when I am warm, he cools me with beating I am waked with it when I sleep raised with it when I sit driven out of doors with it when I go from home welcomed home with it when I return nay, I bear it on my shoulders, as a beggar wont her brat and, I think when he hath lamed me, I shall beg with it from door to door. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Come, go along my wife is coming yonder.
Enter ADRIANA, LUCIANA, the Courtezan, and PINCH

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Mistress, respice finem, respect your end or rather, the prophecy like the parrot, beware the ropesend. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Wilt thou still talk
Beating him

lines.speaker: courtezan
lines.text: How say you now is not your husband mad

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: His incivility confirms no less. Good Doctor Pinch, you are a conjurer Establish him in his true sense again, And I will please you what you will demand.

lines.speaker: luciana
lines.text: Alas, how fiery and how sharp he looks!

lines.speaker: courtezan
lines.text: Mark how he trembles in his ecstasy!

lines.speaker: pinch
lines.text: Give me your hand and let me feel your pulse. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: There is my hand, and let it feel your ear.
Striking him

lines.speaker: pinch
lines.text: I charge thee, Satan, housed within this man, To yield possession to my holy prayers And to thy state of darkness hie thee straight: I conjure thee by all the saints in heaven! ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Peace, doting wizard, peace! I am not mad.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: O, that thou wert not, poor distressed soul! ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: You minion, you, are these your customers Did this companion with the saffron face Revel and feast it at my house today, Whilst upon me the guilty doors were shut And I denied to enter in my house

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: O husband, God doth know you dined at home Where would you had remaind until this time, Free from these slanders and this open shame! ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Dined at home! Thou villain, what sayest thou

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Sir, sooth to say, you did not dine at home. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Were not my doors lockd up and I shut out

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Perdie, your doors were lockd and you shut out. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: And did not she herself revile me there

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Sans fable, she herself reviled you there. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Did not her kitchenmaid rail, taunt, and scorn me

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Certes, she did the kitchenvestal scornd you. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: And did not I in rage depart from thence

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: In verity you did my bones bear witness, That since have felt the vigour of his rage.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: Ist good to soothe him in these contraries

lines.speaker: pinch
lines.text: It is no shame: the fellow finds his vein, And yielding to him humours well his frenzy. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Thou hast subornd the goldsmith to arrest me.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: Alas, I sent you money to redeem you, By Dromio here, who came in haste for it.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Money by me! heart and goodwill you might But surely master, not a rag of money. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Wentst not thou to her for a purse of ducats

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: He came to me and I deliverd it.

lines.speaker: luciana
lines.text: And I am witness with her that she did.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: God and the ropemaker bear me witness That I was sent for nothing but a rope!

lines.speaker: pinch
lines.text: Mistress, both man and master is possessd I know it by their pale and deadly looks: They must be bound and laid in some dark room. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Say, wherefore didst thou lock me forth today And why dost thou deny the bag of gold

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: I did not, gentle husband, lock thee forth.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: And, gentle master, I received no gold But I confess, sir, that we were lockd out.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: Dissembling villain, thou speakst false in both. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Dissembling harlot, thou art false in all And art confederate with a damned pack To make a loathsome abject scorn of me: But with these nails Ill pluck out these false eyes That would behold in me this shameful sport.
Enter three or four, and offer to bind him. He strives

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: O, bind him, bind him! let him not come near me.

lines.speaker: pinch
lines.text: More company! The fiend is strong within him.

lines.speaker: luciana
lines.text: Ay me, poor man, how pale and wan he looks! ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: What, will you murder me Thou gaoler, thou, I am thy prisoner: wilt thou suffer them To make a rescue

lines.speaker: officer
lines.text: Masters, let him go He is my prisoner, and you shall not have him.

lines.speaker: pinch
lines.text: Go bind this man, for he is frantic too.
They offer to bind Dromio of Ephesus

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: What wilt thou do, thou peevish officer Hast thou delight to see a wretched man Do outrage and displeasure to himself

lines.speaker: officer
lines.text: He is my prisoner: if I let him go, The debt he owes will be required of me.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: I will discharge thee ere I go from thee: Bear me forthwith unto his creditor, And, knowing how the debt grows, I will pay it. Good master doctor, see him safe conveyd Home to my house. O most unhappy day! ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: O most unhappy strumpet!

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Master, I am here entered in bond for you. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Out on thee, villain! wherefore dost thou mad me

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Will you be bound for nothing be mad, good master: cry The devil!

lines.speaker: luciana
lines.text: God help, poor souls, how idly do they talk!

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: Go bear him hence. Sister, go you with me. Say now, whose suit is he arrested at
Exeunt all but Adriana, Luciana, Officer and Courtezan

lines.speaker: officer
lines.text: One Angelo, a goldsmith: do you know him

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: I know the man. What is the sum he owes

lines.speaker: officer
lines.text: Two hundred ducats.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: Say, how grows it due

lines.speaker: officer
lines.text: Due for a chain your husband had of him.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: He did bespeak a chain for me, but had it not.

lines.speaker: courtezan
lines.text: When as your husband all in rage today Came to my house and took away my ring The ring I saw upon his finger now Straight after did I meet him with a chain.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: It may be so, but I did never see it. Come, gaoler, bring me where the goldsmith is: I long to know the truth hereof at large.
Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse with his rapier drawn, and DROMIO of Syracuse

lines.speaker: luciana
lines.text: God, for thy mercy! they are loose again.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: And come with naked swords. Lets call more help to have them bound again.

lines.speaker: officer
lines.text: Away! theyll kill us. ANTIPHOLUS
Exeunt all but Antipholus of Syracuse and Dromio of Syracuse

lines.speaker: of syracuse
lines.text: I see these witches are afraid of swords.

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: She that would be your wife now ran from you. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of syracuse
lines.text: Come to the Centaur fetch our stuff from thence: I long that we were safe and sound aboard.

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: Faith, stay here this night they will surely do us no harm: you saw they speak us fair, give us gold: methinks they are such a gentle nation that, but for the mountain of mad flesh that claims marriage of me, I could find in my heart to stay here still and turn witch. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of syracuse
lines.text: I will not stay tonight for all the town Therefore away, to get our stuff aboard.
Exeunt
